author: __flcl
content: Can be MethodNotSupported = -32004 pre Cancun or like that, wdyt?

author: m.kalinin
content: Do you mean introducing a separate error code if there is a timestamp mismatch wrt a minimal hard fork supported by a method, sort of `-38005: Unsupported fork`? Method not supported doesn't sound right to me as actually method *is* supported but aren't allowed to be used for payloads of previous forks

author: __flcl
content: Yep, exactly. "Invalid params" do not sound for this case. MethodNotSupported seemed to be better but indeed not ideal
